summary: This document is an email chain from April 9, 2021, showing a reporter's inquiry to the FBI about Prince Andrew's legal team liaising with the FBI regarding the Epstein investigation, specifically about a photograph of Prince Andrew with Ghislaine Maxwell. The FBI's National Press Office declines to comment.

persons.name: Grant Hodgson
persons.context: A reporter based in LA, working for London's 'The Sunday Mirror', who emails the FBI to inquire about Prince Andrew's legal team's communications with the FBI regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation and a specific photograph.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The Duke of York, whose legal team (Matrix Law) is reportedly liaising with the FBI via another law firm (Blackfords) regarding a photograph of him with Ghislaine Maxwell and the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and convicted sex offender, whose investigation is the subject of the reporter's inquiry to the FBI.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate, convicted for her role in his sex trafficking scheme. The inquiry focuses on a photograph of her with Prince Andrew, reportedly taken by Epstein.

connections.description: Connected via a photograph taken at Maxwell's London home, reportedly by Jeffrey Epstein. The document references an allegation that a victim had sex with the Prince.
Connected through the investigation and the photograph, which Epstein reportedly took.
Maxwell is Epstein's associate, central to the sex trafficking investigation referenced in the inquiry.

events.title: Reporter Inquiry to FBI
events.description: Reporter Grant Hodgson emails the FBI's National Press Office asking for comment on Prince Andrew's legal team liaising with the FBI about the Epstein/Maxwell investigation and a specific photograph.

keyFacts: A reporter inquires about Prince Andrew's London law firm, Matrix Law, liaising with the US law firm Blackfords, which in turn is liaising with the FBI regarding the Epstein investigation.
The inquiry specifically concerns a 'well-known photograph' of Prince Andrew with Ghislaine Maxwell, reportedly taken by Jeffrey Epstein at Maxwell's London home.
The authenticity of this photograph is presented as important because Prince Andrew has denied meeting the alleged victim, while the victim alleges having had sex with him.
The FBI's National Press Office explicitly declines to comment on the inquiry.
